news.content:
PC Sunshine Board and PC Endurance Board both contain UV resistance, and the surface is usually covered with a protective film, some may be double-sided. The most important function of this protective film is to protect the PC board, preventing damage and scratches caused by careless handling, logistics, and installation.

So when installing PC boards, it is necessary to consider the factor of UV resistant coating. How should the side with protective film be installed?

1. Single layer protective film: The protective film should be installed facing the sun, as the solar panel manufacturer may co-extrude a UV coating on the side of the film. Even if the UV is not co-extruded, the side is relatively well protected and plays a role in reflecting harmful light.

2. Double layer protective film: First confirm with the manufacturer which sides the UV coating is on, and install the side with the UV coating facing the sun; If there is no UV coating, choose a well protected side of the solar panel and install it facing the sun.
news.name: Which side of the board protective film should be installed in the sun for the installation of sunlight boards?
news.title: 新闻标题 - CHIANCESS

news.content:
Firstly, sunboards are usually sealed when leaving the factory, and the sealing should be maintained to avoid damage.

Secondly, when storing PC solar panels, it is important to prevent direct sunlight and maintain good ventilation. Before installation, the sun panels are all covered with protective film and should not be damaged to prevent damage to the panels.

Thirdly, if the board is stored in a ventilated and cool place on the construction site, it can be covered with a sunshade net and supported with baldness, which has better ventilation effect and prevents the protective film from sticking and damaging the PC sun board.
Fourth: After the installation of the board is completed, sealing the edges is better and also increases the lifespan of the board.
news.name: How to properly store purchased solar panels?
news.title: 新闻标题 - CHIANCESS

news.content:
The general production process is different, the material selection is different, and the service life is different. For example, if new recycled materials are used or mixed with other non polycarbonate materials, the service life will be three to five years, depending on the amount of mixed materials. Pure high-quality imported polycarbonate materials, such as Bayer or GEsabic raw materials, can generally be used for more than ten years.

A ten-year warranty refers to a 6% decrease in transmittance and a change in yellow index of less than 6% within ten years. This is an indicator that plastic does not age excessively. This means that the physical and mechanical properties of good solar panels will decrease very little after 10 years, and it will not affect their usability. The use of solar panels abroad is generally more than 10 years old.

The seven layer diamond shaped structure solar panel produced by Qiancheng Plastics has good transparency, low thermal conductivity coefficient, and a lifespan of the solar panel. The service life of the solar panel adopts advanced production technology and is manufactured using world-renowned brand Bayer raw materials, fully ensuring the effective use of product quality, with a lifespan of more than ten years. Due to its light weight, long lifespan, and high tensile strength, solar panels can meet the requirements of wind and snow resistance through a simple steel frame structure. They have a long lifespan, are aesthetically pleasing, and reduce repetitive construction and investment. Therefore, they are currently the preferred product to replace original plastic panels or glass skylights.
news.name: The service life of pc hollow sheet
news.title: 新闻标题 - CHIANCESS

news.content:
After decades of dealing with fire classification systems in individual countries or regions, the construction industry can finally benefit from a unified European fire testing standard accepted by all EU member states.

The Single Burning Project (SBI) EN 13823 test is a coordinated standard for the fire performance testing of building products. The product based on this test result is classified according to the European standard EN 13501-1.

The performance of the polycarbonate endurance board using the SBI testing method was excellent, and it received an excellent rating according to EN 13501-1 classification. The best classification of possible combustible materials for Class B S1 and D0 was obtained from polycarbonate endurance plates and solid expression with a thickness of 6mm. Polycarbonate solar panels are classified as b-s1/S2, d0 based on their thickness.

The SBI test is an integrated testing method from France, the United Kingdom, and Germany, based on the existing full-scale room corner fire test method (ISO9705). With a unified system introduction, the construction industry provides several testing methods based on individual countries or regions that can avoid being expensive and time-consuming.

SBI tests fire growth coefficient (FIGRA), lateral flame spread (LSF), total heat release (Thr), smoke growth rate (smoke generation rate index), and total smoke production (TSP). These parameters provide necessary information to establish regulatory agencies and fire engineers to evaluate the superior response of polycarbonate endurance panels to fire characteristics compared to traditional building materials and other engineering plastics, such as PMMA.
news.name: Polycarbonate sheet material with excellent fire resistance performance

knowledge.name: How Do Polycarbonate Hollow Sheets Compare to Glass in Construction?
knowledge.content:
In the realm of construction materials, the debate between polycarbonate hollow sheets and traditional glass has been ongoing. Both materials offer unique advantages and drawbacks, leaving builders and architects pondering which option best suits their needs. In this article, we'll dive into the comparison between polycarbonate empty sheets and glass, looking at their properties, applications, and the contemplations to keep in intellect when choosing between the two.

Why are polycarbonate hollow sheets gaining popularity in construction?

They are gaining popularity in construction due to their versatility, durability, and performance benefits. Their lightweight yet strong composition makes them easy to work with and resistant to impact, weathering, and UV radiation. Additionally, their ability to transmit diffused natural light while providing insulation and soundproofing contributes to energy efficiency and comfort in buildings. Architects and builders appreciate their flexibility in design and wide range of applications, making them an increasingly preferred choice in modern construction projects.

Polcarboynate empty sheets have been relentlessly picking up footing in the development industry for a few reasons. One of the essential variables driving this ubiquity is their remarkable toughness. Not at all like glass, which can smash upon affect, polycarbonate sheets are profoundly safe to breakage. This versatility makes them an appealing choice for applications where security and life span are vital.

Additionally, polycarbonate hollow sheets are lightweight yet robust, making them easier to handle and install compared to glass. This characteristic not only simplifies the construction process but also reduces transportation costs and the risk of breakage during handling.

Furthermore, polycarbonate sheets offer superior thermal insulation properties compared to glass. This capacity to control temperature can lead to vitality investment funds in buildings by decreasing warming and cooling costs. As sustainability becomes an increasingly important consideration in construction, the energy-efficient nature of it positions them as a favorable choice for environmentally conscious projects.

How do the properties of polycarbonate hollow sheets compare to glass?

While contrasting polycarbonate empty sheets with glass, a few key properties become an integral factor: Strength: Polycarbonate sheets ultimately depend on multiple times more grounded than glass of similar thickness, making them profoundly impervious to effect and defacing. Transparency: Though the two materials offer straightforwardness, glass will in general have way better optical lucidity. Nevertheless, movements in polycarbonate development have headed to pushed ahead straightforwardness, making it a sensible elective to glass in various applications. Weight: Polycarbonate sheets are basically lighter than glass, making them less requesting to ship, handle, and present. Insulation: Polycarbonate empty sheets give preferred warm protection over glass, assisting with controlling indoor temperatures and decrease energy utilization. Cost: As a rule, polycarbonate sheets are more financially savvy than glass, both as far as material costs and establishment costs.

What are the practical applications of polycarbonate hollow sheets in construction?

The sheets find a multitude of practical applications in construction due to their versatility, durability, and lightweight properties. One key application is in roofing systems, where these sheets offer excellent impact resistance, UV protection, and weatherproofing capabilities.

They are commonly used in skylights, canopies, and greenhouse roofs, allowing natural light to penetrate while providing insulation and protection from the elements.

In addition to roofing, they are popular for creating translucent partitions and walls in both interior and exterior spaces. Their translucency diffuses light, creating visually appealing environments while offering privacy and sound insulation. These sheets are also used in architectural features such as facades, where their ability to be molded into various shapes and colors allows for innovative and eye-catching designs.

Moreover,they are favored for their strength-to-weight ratio, making them suitable for applications requiring lightweight yet durable materials. They are commonly used in pergolas, carports, and awnings, providing shelter and shade without adding excessive weight to structures. Their impact resistance makes them an ideal choice for safety glazing in areas prone to breakage, such as sports facilities and public buildings.

Furthermore, polycarbonate hollow sheets are valued for their thermal insulation properties, contributing to energy efficiency in buildings. They can be used as cladding material, helping to regulate interior temperatures by minimizing heat transfer and reducing reliance on artificial heating and cooling systems.

Overall, the practical applications of it in construction are extensive and diverse. From roofing to partitioning, from facades to safety glazing, these versatile materials offer architects and builders a wide range of solutions to meet various design requirements while enhancing aesthetics, durability, and energy efficiency in construction projects.

The sheets find diverse applications in construction, ranging from roofing and skylights to partitions and façades. Their versatility and durability make them suitable for both residential and commercial projects.

Roofing: Polycarbonate sheets are commonly used for roofing applications due to their lightweight nature, durability, and excellent weather resistance.

They can withstand harsh environmental conditions, including hail, wind, and UV radiation, making them ideal for outdoor structures such as pergolas, canopies, and greenhouse roofs.

Skylights: The transparency of it makes them well-suited for skylights, allowing natural light to illuminate interior spaces while providing thermal insulation and UV protection. This combination of aesthetics and functionality enhances the overall appeal and energy efficiency of buildings.

Partitions and Façades: In modern architecture, polycarbonate sheets are increasingly being used for interior partitions and façades. Their versatility in terms of color, texture, and transparency allows designers to create visually striking elements while maintaining functionality and practicality.

Conclusion

In conclusion, while glass has long been a staple in construction, polycarbonate hollow sheets offer a compelling alternative with their superior durability, thermal insulation, and cost-effectiveness. As the construction industry continues to evolve, incorporating innovative materials like polycarbonate becomes essential for meeting the demands of sustainability, safety, and efficiency in building design and construction.

If you are interested in our products, you can contact us at: simon@chiancess.com

  2. "Polycarbonate vs. Glass: Comparing Properties" - A&C Plastics
  3. "Polycarbonate Roofing Sheets: Pros & Cons" - Roofing Megastore
  4. "The Benefits of Polycarbonate Roofing Sheets" - Ariel Plastics
  5. "The Advantages of Polycarbonate Hollow Sheets" - Sundely
  6. "Why Polycarbonate Hollow Sheets are the Future of Construction" - Plastics for Africa

This toughness too deciphers to moo support prerequisites, making them a commonsense and cost-effective choice for improving the visual offer of both indoor and open air spaces.

In general, colored empty polycarbonate sheets offer a idealize mix of tasteful flexibility, strength, and usefulness, making them an perfect choice for planners, architects, and property holders looking for to raise the visual request of their ventures.Whether used in commercial, residential, or industrial settings, these innovative materials can transform ordinary spaces into visually stunning and inviting environments.

Colored hollow polycarbonate sheets offer a wide range of vibrant hues and shades, allowing architects and designers to unleash their creativity and enhance the visual appeal of any structure. Whether used in roofing, skylights, or decorative panels, these sheets can add a touch of color and style to any project. The translucent nature of polycarbonate also creates visually stunning effects when combined with lighting, making it ideal for applications such as signage and interior design elements.

In addition to their aesthetic benefits,they are also highly customizable, allowing for the creation of unique patterns, textures, and shapes. This versatility enables designers to achieve their desired look while maintaining the structural integrity and performance of the material.

What Makes Colored Hollow Polycarbonate Sheets Suitable for Natural Lighting Applications?

They are ideal for natural lighting applications due to their translucent nature, which allows diffused sunlight to penetrate interiors while reducing glare and harsh shadows. Their lightweight construction makes them easy to install in various configurations, promoting the efficient use of natural light. Additionally, polycarbonate's UV resistance ensures long-term clarity, maintaining optimal light transmission over time. These qualities make colored hollow polycarbonate sheets a preferred choice for architects and designers seeking to maximize daylighting in buildings while enhancing aesthetics and energy efficiency.

One of the key advantages of colored hollow polycarbonate sheets is their ability to diffuse light evenly, creating a soft and comfortable environment without harsh glares or shadows. This makes them an excellent choice for applications where natural lighting is desired, such as atriums, greenhouses, and covered walkways.

Unlike traditional glass or acrylic panels, polycarbonate sheets are lightweight and easy to install, making them an attractive option for projects where time and budget constraints are a concern. Additionally, the UV-resistant properties of polycarbonate ensure long-lasting clarity and performance, even in outdoor environments exposed to harsh sunlight.

Are Colored Hollow Polycarbonate Sheets Durable and Weather-Resistant?

Colored hollow polycarbonate sheets are renowned for their exceptional durability and weather resistance, making them suitable for a wide range of outdoor applications. Unlike other materials such as glass or PVC, polycarbonate is virtually unbreakable and can withstand extreme temperatures, impact, and UV exposure without yellowing or deteriorating over time.

Additionally, the hollow structure of these sheets provides enhanced insulation properties, helping to regulate temperature and reduce energy costs in both hot and cold climates. This makes them an eco-friendly choice for sustainable building projects seeking to minimize energy consumption and carbon emissions.

Conclusion

In conclusion, colored hollow polycarbonate sheets offer a myriad of advantages that make them a preferred choice for architects, designers, and builders alike. From enhancing aesthetic appeal to providing natural lighting and weather resistance, these versatile sheets offer unmatched performance and durability in a variety of applications. As the demand for sustainable building materials continues to grow, colored hollow polycarbonate sheets are poised to remain a top choice for innovative and environmentally conscious projects. But are they tolycarbonate sheets have become increasingly popular in various industries due to their durability, versatility, and range of appPlicationsruly the best option for your needs? Let’s delve deeper to find out.

Introduction

The day break of the 21st century has proclaimed an period of phenomenal innovative headway, reshaping each feature of human presence. With the coming of the web, counterfeit insights, and biotechnology,ourworld hs ended up progressively interconnected and complex. This interconnecting has not as it were revolutionized the way we communicate, work, and liveut has too displayed us with a horde of openings and challenges.At the forefront of this technological revolution is artificial intelligence ，a field that seeks to imbue machines with human-like intelligence and capabilities. From virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa to autonomous vehicles and cutting-edge medical diagnostics, [Something went wrong, please try again late.

When it comes to selecting the right polycarbonate sheet for your project, it's crucial to consider various factors such as transparency, strength, UV resistance, and thermal insulation. Crystal polycarbonate sheets, renowned for their exceptional clarity and light transmission properties, often emerge as a top choice. However, before making a decision, it's essential to explore the nuances and compare them with other types to ensure you're making an informed choice.

Are Crystal Polycarbonate Sheets the Clearest Option？

Crystal polycarbonate sheets are often hailed for their exceptional clarity, making them a preferred choice for applications where transparency is non-negotiable. Whether it's for skylights, greenhouse panels, or retail displays, the ability to transmit light effectively while maintaining optical clarity is paramount. However, clarity alone might not suffice for certain specialized applications.

When comparing crystal polycarbonate sheets with other variants, such as multiwall or corrugated sheets, clarity remains a defining factor. Multiwall polycarbonate sheets, characterized by their hollow flutes, offer excellent thermal insulation but may compromise on transparency due to their construction. Similarly, corrugated polycarbonate sheets, while durable and lightweight, might not provide the same level of optical clarity as their crystal counterparts.

Ultimately, the choice boils down to the specific requirements of your project. If absolute transparency is a priority, crystal polycarbonate sheets undoubtedly stand out. However, if factors like thermal insulation or impact resistance take precedence, exploring alternative options might be prudent.

How Do Crystal Polycarbonate Sheets Compare in Terms of Durability?

Durability is a critical consideration when selecting polycarbonate sheets, particularly for applications exposed to harsh environmental conditions or high-impact situations. Crystal polycarbonate sheets, renowned for their strength and impact resistance, are often deemed suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. Nevertheless, a closer examination of their durability compared to other types is essential to make an informed decision.

In terms of impact resistance, crystal polycarbonate sheets offer impressive performance, capable of withstanding hail, wind-blown debris, and accidental impacts. This makes them a popular choice for applications such as safety barriers, protective glazing, and machine guards. However, it's crucial to note that the thickness of the sheet also plays a significant role in determining its strength and resilience.

When pitted against alternatives like solid polycarbonate sheets or acrylic (PMMA), crystal polycarbonate sheets often emerge as the preferred option for outdoor use. Solid polycarbonate sheets share similar impact-resistant properties but may lack the clarity of their crystal counterparts. On the other hand, acrylic sheets offer exceptional clarity but are more prone to scratching and may not withstand impacts as effectively.

Are Crystal Polycarbonate Sheets the Best Choice for UV Protection?

UV protection is vital for preserving the optical clarity and longevity of polycarbonate sheets, especially when exposed to direct sunlight. Crystal polycarbonate sheets typically come with UV-coating options, designed to mitigate yellowing and degradation caused by UV radiation. While these coatings offer a level of protection, their efficacy varies depending on the quality of the coating and the manufacturer.

In comparison to other types of polycarbonate sheets, crystal variants often boast superior UV resistance, thanks to specialized coatings applied during the manufacturing process. This makes them suitable for outdoor applications requiring prolonged exposure to sunlight, such as canopy roofs, pergolas, and signage.

However, it's essential to consider the specific environmental conditions and performance requirements of your project. In certain instances, UV-stabilized multiwall polycarbonate sheets may offer comparable UV protection while providing additional benefits such as thermal insulation and light diffusion.

Conclusion

In conclusion, it is evident that through adherence to ethical principles and legal standards, we can ensure responsible and respectful engagement in discussions. By recognizing cultural sensitivities and complying with regulations, we foster an environment of mutual understanding and cooperation. As we navigate diverse topics, it is imperative to prioritize inclusivity and sensitivity, particularly when addressing complex issues. Through open dialogue and mindful communication, we can promote harmony and respect within our interactions.

Moving forward, let us continue to uphold these values, fostering a culture of empathy and understanding in our interactions online and offline. Together, we can contribute to a more inclusive and respectful society, where diverse perspectives are valued and respected respected. while crystal polycarbonate sheets offer exceptional clarity, durability, and UV protection, they may not always be the best choice for every application.

Factors such as thermal insulation, impact resistance, and budgetary constraints must be taken into account when making a decision. By thoroughly evaluating your project requirements and comparing the features of different polycarbonate sheet types, you can select the option that best meets your needs. Our 3 layer polycarbonate sheets find extensive applications across various industries. Our sheets offer unmatched versatility and performance from commercial buildings to agricultural structures. They are commonly used in:

  • Architectural Glazing: Our sheets provide natural light transmission while offering superior impact resistance, making them ideal for skylights, canopies, and atriums.
  • Greenhouses: With excellent light diffusion properties, our sheets promote healthy plant growth while protecting crops from UV radiation and adverse weather conditions.
  • Industrial Roofing: CHIANCESS polycarbonate sheets are an excellent choice for industrial roofing applications due to their lightweight, high strength, and resistance weather.
  • Sound Barriers: The multi-layer structure of our sheets helps dampen sound transmission, making them suitable for noise barriers along highways and railways.
  • Safety Barriers: Their impact resistance makes our polycarbonate sheets perfect for use in safety barriers for stadiums, airports, and public spaces.
  • Decorative Partitions: Available in various colors and finishes, our sheets are used for decorative partitions in offices, hotels, and retail spaces.

Features

  • Triple-layer Structure: Offers enhanced strength and durability.
  • UV Protection: Shields against harmful UV rays, ideal for outdoor use.
  • High Impact Resistance: Withstands extreme weather conditions and physical impacts.
  • Lightweight: Easy to handle and install.
  • Transparency: Maintains clarity for excellent light transmission.
  • Thermal Insulation: Provides effective insulation, suitable for various climates.
  • Customizable Sizes: Available in various thicknesses and dimensions to suit different applications.

Production Process

  • Raw Material Selection: High-quality polycarbonate resin is chosen for its strength and durability.
  • Extrusion: The polycarbonate resin is melted and extruded into sheets with a triple-layer structure.
  • Surface Treatment: Optional surface coatings or treatments may be applied for UV protection or specific functionalities.
  • Cooling and Sizing: The extruded sheets are cooled and then cut to the desired dimensions.
  • Quality Inspection: Each sheet undergoes rigorous quality checks to ensure consistency and performance.

FAQ 

Q: Can it be used for curved applications?

A: Yes, the flexibility of polycarbonate allows it to be easily shaped and bent to fit curved surfaces, making it suitable for curved applications such as domes or skylights.

Q: How does it compare to glass in terms of durability?

A: Polycarbonate sheets are much more durable than glass. They are virtually unbreakable and resistant to impact, while glass is prone to shattering upon impact.

Q: Is it suitable for greenhouse construction?

A: Yes, polycarbonate sheets are commonly used in greenhouse construction due to their excellent light transmission, durability, and thermal insulation properties.

Q: How do I clean and maintain the polycarbonate sheets?

A: To clean the polycarbonate board, use a mild neutral detergent with water and a soft cloth or sponge. Avoid using abrasive cleaning agents or materials that may scratch the surface. Thoroughly rinse with clean water, avoiding forceful wiping or scrubbing to avoid scratches.

Twin wall polycarbonate sheet, also referred to as multiwall polycarbonate sheet, is a versatile thermoplastic material extensively utilized in diverse fields, notably construction. Comprising numerous layers of polycarbonate material, it typically features hollow chambers or ribs between them, resembling the structure of a honeycomb.

Specifications

Thickness (mm) Width (mm) Length (mm) Color Options
4mm 1220/1830/2100mm 5800/5900/11600/11800/12000mm Clear, Bronze,Opal
6mm 1220/1830/2100mm 5800/5900/11600/11800/12000mm Blue,Lake blue,Green
8mm 1220/1830/2100mm 5800/5900/11600/11800/12000mm Orange,Red,Grey
10mm 1220/1830/2100mm 5800/5900/11600/11800/12000mm Amber,Silver,Gold

Application Fields 

1. Construction: Twin-wall polycarbonate sheets are extensively employed in construction for roofing, skylights, and facades. 

2. Agriculture: These sheets are widely used for greenhouse construction, providing optimal light transmission for plant growth and protection against harsh weather conditions.

3.Architecture: Architects often incorporate polycarbonate twin wall sheet into their designs for aesthetic purposes and functional benefits. These sheets can be used in innovative ways to create visually striking features such as canopies, partitions, and decorative elements in modern architectural projects.

4. Signage and Displays: Due to their clarity and durability, this is favored materials for signage and displays. They can be easily customized and printed on, making them suitable for indoor and outdoor advertising applications, as well as for creating informative displays in public spaces.

5. Safety Barriers and Enclosures: these are utilized in various safety applications, including protective barriers, machine guards, and enclosures. Their impact resistance and shatterproof properties make them an excellent choice for enhancing safety in industrial environments and public spaces.

6. DIY Projects: Hobbyists and DIY enthusiasts often use double wall polycarbonate sheet for a variety of projects, including backyard sheds, garden cloches, and hobby greenhouses. Their versatility, ease of handling, and availability in various sizes make them an accessible material for creative endeavors.

Features

  • High impact resistance
  • Superior thermal insulation
  • UV protection
  • Lightweight design
  • Excellent optical clarity
  • Easy to install and maintain
  • Customizable sizes and colors
 

 

Production Process

Our Twin Wall Polycarbonate Sheets are manufactured using state-of-the-art extrusion technology. The process involves melting polycarbonate resin pellets and extruding them through a die to form twin-wall panels. These panels are then cooled, cut to size, and undergo quality inspection to ensure compliance with industry standards.

Quality Control

At CHIANCESS, quality is our top priority. We adhere to stringent quality control measures throughout the production process to ensure that our polycarbonate sheets meet the highest standards of performance and durability. Our in-house testing facilities enable us to conduct thorough quality checks on raw materials, production processes, and finished products, thereby guaranteeing customer satisfaction and product reliability.

FAQ

Q: What is the maximum temperature resistance of your polycarbonate sheets?

A: Our polycarbonate twin wall sheets have a maximum temperature resistance of up to 120°C.

Q: Can your sheets be curved or bent?

A: Yes, our sheets can be cold-formed to achieve curved or bent shapes as per specific project requirements.

Q: Do you provide installation services?

A: While we do not offer installation services, our sheets come with comprehensive installation guidelines to facilitate easy setup.

Q: Are your polycarbonate sheets recyclable?

A: Yes, our sheets are fully recyclable, contributing to sustainability efforts in the construction and manufacturing industries.

For inquiries or to request a quote, please contact us at simon@chiancess.com. Choose CHIANCESS for premium quality Twin Wall Polycarbonate Sheets backed by expertise, reliability, and prompt delivery.

about_us.content:
Haining Chiancess Plastic Co., Ltd. is a comprehensive enterprise integrating polycarbonate sheet design, R&D, and manufacturing. Located in Zhejiang Province, China, 70 km from Shanghai.
Established in 2011 with a registered capital of US$ 2 million and an area of 8,000 square meters. Chances polycarbonate solid sheet, twin-wall sheet, multiwall sheet, u-shape multiwall sheet, corrugated sheet, and other products are widely used in sports stadiums, transportation facilities, agricultural greenhouses, carports, awing, light box advertising, sound barriers, and other construction projects. 
Annual output has reached 7000 tons. With the most famous brands polycarbonate resin SABIC and MAKROLON, our products receive a good reputation all over the world, supply 10 years warranty make our clients no worry.
